intro: Morisonia pachaca, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are broad and hairy, adapted to withstand the harsh mountain climate. Morisonia pachaca is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens that replicate its natural environment.
